channel.title: Books on Mutt0-ds Notes
channel.description: Recent content in Books on Mutt0-ds Notes

item.title: 10% Happier
item.description: Meditation can make you at LEAST 10% happier
Time harmonizes

item.title: 21 Lessons for the 21st Century
item.description: History repeats itself. Let’s study

item.title: 48 Rules For Power
item.description: Do not follow these teachings, but unfortunately it is true: the people around us lie and manipulate; we need to be aware of it.

item.title: A Beautifully Foolish Endeavor
item.description: Power should not be in the hands of the powerful

item.title: A Brief History of Time - From the Big Bang to Black Holes
item.description: With a complete theory we will explain why the universe exists; it would mark the triumph of human reason, for then we would know the mind of God.

item.title: A Mind for Numbers: How to Excel at Math and Science
item.description: Recall. Rework and question what you just read, simplifying it as if you had to explain it to a child

item.title: A Short History of Nearly Everything
item.description: We are very lucky to be here, alive, and we have only one chance and one planet to survive

item.title: All Marketers Are Liars
item.description: Not everyone is a liar; customers tell themselves lies and marketers sell them the stories they want to hear

item.title: All the Presidents' Bankers
item.description: Big bankers have total control; they can speculate undisturbed knowing they are too big to fail

item.title: An Absolutely Remarkable Thing
item.description: Fame drives people crazy

item.title: An Elegant Puzzle
item.description: To survive in a hyper-evolving system, you need to be flexible about migration and skilled at handling the facets of management, from hiring to culture and organization

item.title: An Open Heart
item.description: The best response to an enemy who wishes us harm is to be happy: getting stressed only plays into their hands, without them even having to act

item.title: Antifragile. Thriving in Disorder
item.description: Antifragility is beyond resilience or robustness. The resilient resists shocks and stays the same; the antifragile gets better

item.title: Automate the boring stuff with Python
item.description: With Python, you can automate any boring and predictable task

item.title: Backstabbing for Beginners
item.description: The United Nations was (and is, I imagine) a gigantic and messy organization

item.title: Bad Blood: Secrets and Lies in a Silicon Valley Startup
item.description: Theranos fooled the world with a mountain of lies, networking, and aggressive lawyers. Watch out for that world

item.title: Bad Science
item.description: We have biases that charlatans and marketers exploit to sell us nonsense. Watch out

item.title: Become an Effective Software Engineering Manager
item.description: your output + your team’s output = result. This changes now.

item.title: Being Geek
item.description: Expect surprises. We seek definition to understand the system so that we can discern the rules so that we know what to do next so that we win. Managers hate surprises

item.title: Bogleheads' Guide To Investing
item.description: Tune Out The Noise - Master Your Emotions

item.title: Brain Rules for Baby
item.description: Children absorb everything, behaviors, words, emotions. And they empathize. A lot

item.title: Brotopia
item.description: Bro culture is everywhere in Silicon Valley and the IT world

item.title: Bullshit Jobs: A Theory
item.description: Part of office work is pointless and creates a harmful sense of depression for the worker

item.title: Candide (Optimism)
item.description: Baseless optimism is stupid, there are many misfortunes in the world. Focus on intellect

item.title: Car Guys vs. Bean Counters
item.description: No point having a perfectly functioning mechanism that produces mediocre results. Focus on the outside, the customers, not just internal KPIs!

item.title: Clean Code
item.description: The Boy Scout Rule: leave the code better than you found it.

item.title: Cloud Atlas
item.description: Nothing lasts forever, but everything is connected

item.title: Code: The Hidden Language of Computer Hardware and Software
item.description: Behind a computer there is literally a world of things to learn, from electrons to web protocols

item.title: Codeless Data Structures and Algorithms
item.description: To learn the basics of algorithms you sometimes do not need code, you can do it with practical examples

item.title: Company of One
item.description: The ‘company of one’ model can be laid out in a similar fashion: ‘start small, define growth, and keep learning.

item.title: Complete Car Care Manual
item.description: Maintaining a car matters, some repairs you can do yourself… But be careful, the system is very, very complex!

item.title: Cracking the Coding Interview
item.description: I will struggle with a Google interview

item.title: Designing data-intensive applications
item.description: Databases have many potential problems to explore, understand, and anticipate. Especially distributed ones

item.title: Developer Relations
item.description: To sell a product aimed at developers, you need to think like they do.

item.title: Devil Take The Hindmost
item.description: History repeats itself; crises are driven by human short-sighted greed

item.title: Difficult Women: An Imperfect History of Feminism
item.description: Feminism has made great strides over the past century, though the work is not finished, and understanding its major battles is important

item.title: Digital Dementia
item.description: Media are harmful; they make us dumber and overweight. Above all, don’t let children overuse them

item.title: East of Eden
item.description: Family stories are complicated, and back then in America life was hard

item.title: Emotional Agility
item.description: Dance if you can

item.title: Emotional First Aid
item.description: Rejection, Loneliness, Loss, Guilt, Rumination, Failure, and Low Self-esteem: quick recipes to heal us from these invisible (but painful) wounds

item.title: Emotional Intelligence
item.description: The brain has two sides, one of more rational intelligence, and one of emotional intelligence. Empathy, understanding others, listening.

item.title: Engineers Survival Guide
item.description: Play for the long game. Whatever happens, you will be working for decades. As long as you have joy and happiness in what you do, which is wonderful, do not sweat the daily annoyances. And do not run yourself ragged for a job; what matters is being happy.

item.title: Escaping the Build Trap
item.description: Do not focus on shipping something; you need to create value. The build trap is when organizations become stuck measuring their success by outputs rather than outcomes

item.title: Everybody Writes: Your Go-To Guide for Creating Ridiculously Good Content
item.description: There are no shortcuts to becoming a better writer. So show up at your desk and get to it. Daily.

item.title: Extreme Ownership: How U.S. Navy SEALs Lead and Win
item.description: What you learn about leadership on the battlefield will help you in everyday life

item.title: Febbre
item.description: Growing up with dysfunctional families is hell

item.title: Finding Moonshine
item.description: Group theory is complicated stuff, but it is simply about analyzing the various movements of figures in n dimensions that preserve their symmetry

item.title: Food Rules: An Eater's Manual
item.description: Eat food. Mostly plants. Not too much

item.title: Fooled by Randomness
item.description: People constantly forget that it’s all a matter of luck

item.title: Foundation (Series)
item.description: The story of the Foundation is… complicated

item.title: Four Thousand Weeks: Time Management for Mortals
item.description: Life is short, and the pursuit of constant productivity only leads to dissatisfaction because you will never finish your to-do list. In fact, the more you do, the more gets assigned to you

item.title: Frequently Asked Questions About the Universe
item.description: It’s great to ask lots of questions about the universe, and even if we still do not know much, scientists are doing a lot of important work

item.title: Fundamentals of Data Engineering
item.description: Work with data across all its phases and determine both the best solution for your case and the stakeholders involved

item.title: Getting Things Done
item.description: If you can do this thing in less than two minutes, do it; otherwise delegate it or note it in your master archive

item.title: Gli Sdraiati
item.description: Teenagers are an alien people

item.title: Gödel, Escher, Bach. An Eternal Golden Braid
item.description: Understanding strange loops and self-reference is the key to developing real artificial intelligence

item.title: Good Calories, Bad Calories
item.description: Carbohydrates and sugars cause more problems than fats

item.title: Greenlights
item.description: Create your own green lights, face your challenges, and always keep exploring yourself

item.title: Grokking Algorhithms
item.description: Think in Big O, something that changes by a few seconds can scale very badly

item.title: Guerrilla Analytics : A Practical Approach to Working with Data
item.description: Keep your working folder organized in a simple, predictable and intuitive way

item.title: Guns, Germs, and Steel
item.description: Human society evolved this way, with these disparities, because of a simple question of geography. Eurasia starts ahead

item.title: Hands-on Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn and TensorFlow
item.description: Building good ML models requires strong knowledge of the scikit-learn and TensorFlow libraries, lots of math, and substantial resources

item.title: Harry Potter and the Methods of Rationality
item.description: Harry Potter if he used the logic and cynicism of an intellectual… Unrealistic and very long but nice

item.title: Head First Design Patterns
item.description: Design patterns are useful tools in the toolbox to use when you need them

item.title: Head First HTML and CSS
item.description: HTML and CSS have a few issues across different browsers, but they are essential for understanding how web pages work

item.title: Hidden Valley Road Inside the Mind of an American Family
item.description: Living with a person with schizophrenia is really, really tough. Imagine 6.

item.title: Hold Me Tight: Seven Conversations for a Lifetime of Love
item.description: Recognize the Demon Dialogues and explore with your partner the reasons behind them. Often it is a search for affection and for feeling the other’s support. Talk about it.

item.title: How Not To Die
item.description: Eating a balanced, plant-rich diet helps you live longer

item.title: How the World Really Works
item.description: The world is complex, and few truly understand that energy requires immense effort and many nonrenewable resources to produce. Imagining that we can change the world with a couple of laws and a few years is pure illusion

item.title: How to Be Perfect: The Correct Answer to Every Moral Question
item.description: Know thyself & Nothing in Excess

item.title: How to Fail at Almost Everything and Still Win Big
item.description: Failure is just an opportunity to grow. And do not listen to cartoonists

item.title: How to Have Impossible Conversations
item.description: The goal is not to win, but to listen… and maybe plant a seed of doubt

item.title: How to Make Things Faster
item.description: Optimization is often more political than technical

item.title: How to Stop Time
item.description: Everything will work out for the best. Or at least, it will happen, so there is no point worrying. I understand that the way to stop time is to stop letting it rule you

item.title: How to Talk So Kids Will Listen & Listen So Kids Will Talk
item.description: Show that you understand them and DESCRIBE what you see and hear. Give information, do not judge, and put yourself in their shoes. Hmm… I see. It must be Annoying/Stressful/Traumatic etc…

item.title: How To Talk To Anyone
item.description: There are unwritten rules in communication, especially in business. Note them all.

item.title: How to Win Friends and Influence People
item.description: Always give others the impression that they are important

item.title: How Your House Works
item.description: Knowing the behind the scenes of appliances is very useful for being able to repair them and not feel intimidated

item.title: Il Fascismo Eterno
item.description: Fascism has some important key traits, let’s not forget them

item.title: Il Genio Non Esiste
item.description: Geniuses are ordinary people, often incredibly lucky or building on others’ work. So, crew, want to become geniuses? Go out there and have fun. And preferably do it legally.

item.title: Impact Mapping: Making a big impact with software products and projects
item.description: Not a priority right now, but an impact map will be a useful tool to manage a project

item.title: Impro
item.description: Be like a child when improvising: pure creativity requires ignoring the mental limits we have been given. In every conversation one person has higher status and one lower

item.title: Influence : the psychology of persuasion
item.description: We do not think with a clear mind. Before making a decision, like buying from a salesperson, ask yourself ‘do I like this choice much more than I expected to?’

item.title: Inspired: How to Create Tech Products Customers Love
item.description: No more roadmaps. The push should come from the bottom, then test. Missionaries, not mercenaries

item.title: It's Ok That You're Not Ok
item.description: Grief cannot be fixed. Only carried forward

item.title: Kitchen Confidential
item.description: The world of professional kitchens is absolutely crazy

item.title: L’inganno dei confini: Come la geografia governa il mondo
item.description: Borders are the scars of history

item.title: Leading Effective Engineering Teams
item.description: A good manager communicates and listens

item.title: Learn Git in a Month of Lunches
item.description: Git is simple in principle: know the basic commands and Google the rest

item.title: LLM Engineer's Handbook
item.description: Building an AI pipeline can feel like a lot of work, but in the end it is simple

item.title: Looks Good to Me
item.description: You are not your code. A code review is meant to achieve shared code quality for everyone’s benefit

item.title: Man's Search for Meaning
item.description: What you have lived, no power in the world can take from you

item.title: Reckoning with Risk
item.description: Learn to use “thumb rules” to make simple, fast, and convenient decisions when needed

item.title: The Cuckoo's Egg
item.description: Back then tracking hackers was chaotic, and nobody cared

item.title: The Man Who Mistook His Wife for a Hat
item.description: There are many strange and particular neurological disorders. We should look at them with a critical eye

item.title: The Shadow of the Wind
item.description: Excellent novel with entertaining characters and constant twists

item.title: The Warren Buffett Way
item.description: Buffett does not buy to speculate; he looks carefully at numbers, managers, and undervalued ideas for the long term

item.title: The Worst Journey in the World
item.description: The South Pole is cold, don’t bring ponies

item.title: Worth Dying for - The Power and Politics of Flags
item.description: Every flag is much more than a piece of cloth, it represents millions of people and what they believe. There are fascinating stories behind them

item.title: Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance
item.description: Does Quality permeate the universe? Who knows. Also, if you have patience and attention you can often maintain the bike without always going to a mechanic
